title: How Bari Weiss of The Free Press Won the Top Job at CBS News
description: At The Free Press, she battled “wokeness” and buddied up with billionaires. Now she’s the editor in chief of CBS News.

title: Paramount Buys Bari Weiss’s Free Press, Starting a New Era at CBS News
description: Bari Weiss, a founder of The Free Press, will become editor in chief of CBS News.

title: Hacks at Marks & Spencer, Jaguar Land Rover and Co-op Disrupt UK Daily Life
description: Jaguar Land Rover is the third big British brand to have its operations severely affected by a breach this year.

title: Sign Up for DealBook
description: Make sense of the latest business and policy headlines with our daily newsletter.

title: OpenAI’s Team of Rivals Now Includes AMD and Nvidia
description: The artificial intelligence giant just announced a major partnership with AMD — weeks after striking a big deal with the chipmaker’s competitor, Nvidia.

title: Belva Davis, West Coast Trailblazer in TV News, Dies at 92
description: Overcoming poverty and prejudice, she was the first Black woman to be hired as a television reporter in the region and later became a popular anchor.

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘Showgirl’ Promotional Film Collects $33 Million
description: “The Official Release Party of a Showgirl” drastically outperformed “The Smashing Machine,” a vehicle for Dwayne Johnson, known to fans as the Rock.

title: Your Wealthiest Friend Has a Private Concierge
description: The services, which can cost more than $50,000 a year, make impossible dinner reservations and finagle special treatment. In certain circles, they’ve become a common luxury.

title: Journalists at 3 Alaska Newspapers Quit Over Charlie Kirk Story
description: The publications in Alaska lost significant staffing after the owners made changes to an article that had drawn criticism from a Republican state lawmaker.

title: Government Shutdown Leaves Wall Street Without Jobs Data
description: Investors are grappling with a blackout of official government economic data that’s forcing them to rely more heavily on reports that usually get far less attention.

title: OpenAI’s Sora Makes Disinformation Extremely Easy and Extremely Real
description: The new A.I. app generated videos of store robberies and home intrusions — even bomb explosions on city streets — that never happened.

title: ‘S.N.L.’ Season 51: What to Know Before the Premiere
description: “Saturday Night Live” is back this weekend with several new cast members. It’s facing a particularly fraught climate for political jokes on TV.

title: Leo Hindery Jr., Dealmaking Power in the Cable TV Industry, Dies at 77
description: As an executive, he helped negotiate AT&T’s $50 billion acquisition of TCI and later led the Yankees’ YES Network. He also drove his sports car to victory in the 24 Hours of Le Mans.

title: Paramount Nears a Deal to Buy Bari Weiss’s Free Press
description: Ms. Weiss, a co-founder of the site, would become editor in chief of CBS News, people briefed on the talks said.

title: The Consequences of Trump’s Setback at the Fed
description: A Supreme Court decision that keeps a Fed governor on the job for now could scramble President Trump’s effort to add more loyalists at the central bank.

title: How Social Media Is Changing the Narrative of the Israel-Gaza War
description: Nearly two years into the conflict, social media is increasingly capturing the day-to-day toll in Gaza, as U.S. public opinion on the war shifts.

title: How a Government Shutdown Could Affect the Economy
description: Investors have shaken off threats of damage from shutdowns before. But federal layoffs, pauses in economic data and more could make this time different.

title: Markets Brace for the Costs of a Shutdown
description: An economic data blackout, potential delays to I.P.O.s, and a furlough tab of perhaps $400 million dollars a day could add volatility, investors fear.

title: Kimmel and Colbert, Joined in New York, Show a United Front
description: The two late-night hosts shared stories on each other’s shows on Tuesday about their recent turmoil, and some criticism of President Trump.

title: A Guinness Heiress Goes to Netflix
description: Ivana Lowell talks about spinning her high-drama family tales into “House of Guinness” with the “Peaky Blinders” creator Steven Knight.

title: Neil Kraft, Visionary Adman Who Sold ‘a Mood and a Lifestyle,’ Dies at 67
description: His ads for Calvin Klein and others captured a fizzy moment in the 1980s and ’90s, featuring celebrities like the young rapper Marky Mark wearing nothing but underwear and a grin.

title: $55 Billion Deal for Electronic Arts Is Biggest Buyout Ever
description: Jared Kushner’s private equity firm and Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund are some of the investors teaming up to take the video game giant private.

title: Mike Cavanagh Named Co-CEO of Comcast
description: Mr. Cavanagh will run the media giant alongside Brian L. Roberts, its longtime chairman and chief executive, in a clear sign of succession planning.

title: Why Don’t Data Centers Use More Green Energy?
description: Reliance on fossil fuels is almost unavoidable — at least for now.

title: The Math Behind Eric Adams’s Exit
description: Mayor Eric Adams’s abandoning his re-election bid may please some business leaders opposed to Zohran Mamdani. But it may not change the outcome of the race.

title: ‘One Battle After Another’ Ticket Sales Are Solid (With an Asterisk)
description: Paul Thomas Anderson’s film collected $22.4 million in North America over the weekend, enough for No. 1. But its profitability remains a big question.

title: What’s Behind Nexstar and Sinclair Boycotting Jimmy Kimmel?
description: Nexstar and Sinclair say their boycott of the late-night host is all about what he said. But both are exploring deals for their sprawling networks of local TV stations.

title: Marketing Movies Is Harder Than Ever. And Here Comes ‘One Battle After Another.’
description: The film is the kind that isn’t supposed to work in theaters anymore. But Warner Bros., the studio behind it, has successfully bucked trends for months now.

title: Whom Might the Trump Administration Go After Next?
description: The president suggested more foes, including the billionaire Democratic donors George Soros and Reid Hoffman, could face legal scrutiny. Could others follow?

title: You Asked for More of Mel Taub’s Puzzles. Here Are Three.
description: With his Puns and Anagrams puzzles, Mr. Taub made solvers groan and grin for decades. After he died this month, readers expressed appreciation for his work.

title: Sinclair and Nexstar End Jimmy Kimmel Boycott on Local ABC Stations
description: Sinclair and Nexstar have been pre-empting Mr. Kimmel’s show since he returned this week.

title: Daily Caller Opinion Column ‘Explicitly’ Calls for Violence
description: The column, by editor at large Geoffrey Ingersoll, calls for “blood in the streets” in response to violence against conservatives.

title: Trump Clears Way for American-Owned TikTok Valued at $14 Billion
description: The administration has been working for months to find non-Chinese investors for a U.S. version of the app.

title: What a Potential Apple-Intel Deal Says About Trump’s Pull Over Big Tech
description: Talks about a potential investment by the iPhone maker raise further questions about the chip giant, which now has close ties to Washington.

title: The Rates Debate Dividing the Fed
description: Jerome Powell and some of the more dovish policymakers at the central bank are at odds over how to handle “challenging” inflation and unemployment.

title: Germany Woos Indian Workers Spooked by Trump’s H-1B Visa Fee
description: Selling the prospect of high wages and stable migration rules, Germany’s ambassador to India makes a pitch to skilled Indian workers.

title: Ron DiMenna, Ron Jon Surf Shop Founder, Dies at 88
description: As the founder of a national chain, he was a key figure in surfing’s expansion into mainstream culture, with a life said to be “the stuff of folklore.”

title: Meta Ramps Up Spending on A.I. Politics With New Super PAC
description: The new PAC, which is the second that Meta has unveiled in the last month, is aimed at backing those in support of the artificial intelligence industry.

title: What Will Jimmy Kimmel Say Tonight?
description: The return of the late-night host’s show raises questions about how the Trump administration, TV affiliate owners and viewers might react.

title: H-1B Visa Upheaval Roils Companies and Geopolitics
description: The Trump administration has clarified its new visa policy, but corporate bosses are still trying to sort through the fallout.

title: What Wall Street Sees in the Data Center Boom
description: Data center capacity has become a barometer for both the health of the tech market and the risk of an A.I. bubble.

title: They Created a Streetwear Line From Scratch. In High School.
description: At a school with a basketball-themed curriculum, students were “dreaming big.” But could they find a buyer?

title: How Aditi Shah, a Peloton Yoga Instructor, Spends Her Day in the Studio
description: Aditi Shah’s day stretches from a 5:30 a.m. meditation to an after-dinner walk, with business meetings in between.

title: A Beauty Line Built on Experience and Influence
description: Denise Vasi, founder of the Maed lip line, says her online profile helped her reach customers, but it also generated skepticism.

title: Joshua Abram Dies at 62; Gave Workspace-Sharing an Upscale Spin
description: He and a partner made their co-working locations feel like private clubs. Among his other ventures, he sought to slash the cost of in vitro fertilization by using robotics and A.I.

title: Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift Are Engaged. Kansas City Is Enchanted.
description: Chiefs fans have been cheering on their star football player’s romance with the pop star for two years. They have the T-shirts, earrings and baked goods to prove it.

title: The All-Female Hacker House Trying to Break A.I.’s Glass Ceiling
description: FoundHer House, a home in San Francisco’s Glen Park neighborhood, is the rare all-female hacker house where residents are creating a supportive community to build their start-ups.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Become a Wild Card for Board Game Makers
description: Trade war uncertainty is forcing board and card game publishers in the United States to make tough decisions, putting the future of the industry in jeopardy.

title: How Tariffs Will Affect This Unique Cheese
description: Stilton is a special type of blue cheese that can be made in only three English counties. There are just four producers of Stilton left, but this one was crowned best cheese in the world, according to one of the industry’s top awards last year. Eshe Nelson, a business reporter for The New York Times, went to Clawson Farms, the producer of the award-winning Stilton, which is trying to expand its business in the United States, despite the higher costs imposed by the Trump administration’s tariff policy.

title: Richard Lee, Activist Who Founded a Pot ‘University,’ Dies at 62
description: After he was paralyzed in an accident, his use of marijuana for medical purposes led him to become one of the nation’s most influential cannabis activists.

title: Do Kwon, Crypto Founder Who Caused 2022 Market Crash, Pleads Guilty to Fraud
description: Do Kwon, who created the Luna and TerraUSD cryptocurrencies that collapsed in 2022, pleaded guilty to two counts of fraud, capping a spectacular fall from grace.

title: Larry Ellison Wants to Do Good, Do Research and Make a Profit
description: Oracle’s co-founder and the world’s second-richest person pledges to concentrate his vast resources on his own research institute and for-profit ventures to address health, hunger and climate change.

title: Swarming to San Francisco’s A.I. Boom: a New Crop of 20-Something CEOs
description: Some dropped out of M.I.T., Georgetown and Stanford. Others decided not to go to college. They all say they could not afford to wait to build their own artificial intelligence start-ups.

title: A.I. Has Ushered in Silicon Valley’s ‘Hard Tech’ Era
description: Goodbye to the age of consumer websites and mobile apps. Artificial intelligence has ushered in an era of what insiders in the nation’s innovation capital call “hard tech.”

title: Lina Khan: Democrats Can Learn from Zohran Mamdani
description: Democrats need to win back America’s small businesses.

title: Customers Griped About High Grocery Prices. The Grocer Agreed.
description: After hearing complaints about his prices, a store owner in Brooklyn has apologized, and begun the laborious task of lowering thousands of them.

title: Cognition AI Buys Windsurf as A.I. Frenzy Escalates
description: The deal follows Google’s $2.4 billion investment in Windsurf, an A.I. start-up, as companies race to gain technological talent and provide A.I. tools.

title: How Yemeni Cafes like Haraz Coffee House Are Building Momentum and Community
description: For cafes like Haraz Coffee House, riding a wave of interest nationwide in late-night, alcohol-free gathering spaces means embracing the franchise model.

title: The Coder ‘Village’ at the Heart of China’s A.I. Frenzy
description: As China vies with Silicon Valley for primacy, Hangzhou, home to DeepSeek and Alibaba, is where its aspiring tech titans mingle and share ideas.

title: The Perilous Business of Importing Indian Mangoes to the U.S.
description: For a few short months, dozens of part-time importers in New Jersey relentlessly compete to get the fruit into the hands of an eager diaspora.

title: Blue Jays Star Vladimir Guerrero Jr. Dominates Yankees Through Two Games Of ALDS
description: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. is 6-for-9 in the first two games of the Division Series for the Blue Jays, who dominated the Yankees this weekend.

title: De Beers Launches Desert Diamonds Campaign With Splashy New York Event
description: The London-based gemstone mining, distribution, and retail company is responding to consumer insights to promote its neutral range of colored diamonds.

title: OpenAI’s ChatGPT Now Connects With Third-Party Apps Like Spotify And Zillow: Here’s The Latest In The AI Arms Race
description: Artificial intelligence products are launching at a rapid pace as the sector’s largest companies battle for supremacy and secure increasingly large valuations worth hundreds of billions of dollars.

title: ‘Monster: The Ed Gein Story’ Ending Explained—What Does The Final Scene Mean?
description: Netflix’s "Monster: The Ed Gein Story" ends with an unexpected twist connecting Ed Gein to Ted Bundy and other serial killers. Here’s what happens in the finale and what it all means.

title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr., Showed Star Sparkle In Arizona Fall League
description: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. is on fire at the plate for the Toronto Blue Jays. No surprise, especially for those who watched him play for Surprise — of the Arizona Fall League

title: Cabot Has Unrivaled Scottish Highlands Golf Combo With New Doak Course
description: The addition of Old Petty gives Cabot Highlands a strong 1-2 punch in a region of Scotland often overshadowed, helping it seize the international destination spotlight.

title: Fight Fraud First: A Bipartisan Path To Save Medicare’s Home Health Benefit
description: Aging seniors and those with chronic conditions have been able to rely on Medicare for home health care. Now, the benefit may be at risk, writes Debbie Stabenow.

title: Iraqi Kurdistan’s Erbil Still A Vital Hub For U.S. Anti-ISIS Campaign
description: Given its geographical proximity, reliable access, and relative security, Erbil serves as a vital launchpad for U.S. operations against Islamic State remnants in Syria.

title: De Beers Unveils ‘Desert Diamonds’ In Major Campaign For Natural Over Lab-Grown Diamonds
description: De Beers launched its largest diamond campaign in a decade to promote "Desert Diamonds," natural colored stones, emphasizing rarity, uniqueness and connection to nature.

title: Three Most Disappointing College Football Teams So Far This Season
description: College football season may just be nearing the midway point of the season, but these three teams have solidified themselves as the most disappointing programs so far in the FBS.

title: Ukraine’s Sea Drones Are Now Launching Unjammable Fiber-Optic Drones
description: Unjammable fiber-optic FPVs launched from sea drones are giving Ukraine a new way to strike Russian targets inland.

title: Fading Los Angeles Chargers Continue To Slide With No End In Sight
description: The Chargers are reeling, as the sugar high of three straight wins to open the season has transformed into shoddy play and two-straight losing performances.

title: Jay Glennie On His 10-Book Odyssey Documenting Films Of Quentin Tarantino: ‘You’re Going To Have To Reinforce Your Shelf’
description: The Making of Quentin Tarantino’s Once Upon a Time...in Hollywood goes on sale from Insight Editions Tuesday, October 28.

description: Bari Weiss, founder of The Free Press, is joining CBS News as its first editor-in-chief following her site’s acquisition by Paramount Skydance.

description: The administration is trying to send hundreds of members of the Texas National Guard to Chicago.

title: 6 Surprising Ingredients For Fall Cocktails—And How To Use Them
description: Move over, pumpkin spice. From beets to mushrooms, bartenders share fresh ingredients redefining fall cocktails with bold, seasonal flavors.

description: “Red Alert,” a four-part scripted series based on Hamas’ attack on Israel on Oct. 7, 2023, is new on streaming this week. Find out when and where you can watch the series at home.

description: The court will consider Trump’s tariffs, LGBTQ conversion therapy, and more.

title: How Tariffs Will Affect This Unique Cheese
description: Stilton is a special type of blue cheese that can be made in only three English counties. There are just four producers of Stilton left, but this one was crowned best cheese in the world, according to one of the industry’s top awards last year. Eshe Nelson, a business reporter for The New York Times, went to Clawson Farms, the producer of the award-winning Stilton, which is trying to expand its business in the United States, despite the higher costs imposed by the Trump administration’s tariff policy.

title: Richard Lee, Activist Who Founded a Pot ‘University,’ Dies at 62
description: After he was paralyzed in an accident, his use of marijuana for medical purposes led him to become one of the nation’s most influential cannabis activists.

title: Do Kwon, Crypto Founder Who Caused 2022 Market Crash, Pleads Guilty to Fraud
description: Do Kwon, who created the Luna and TerraUSD cryptocurrencies that collapsed in 2022, pleaded guilty to two counts of fraud, capping a spectacular fall from grace.

title: Larry Ellison Wants to Do Good, Do Research and Make a Profit
description: Oracle’s co-founder and the world’s second-richest person pledges to concentrate his vast resources on his own research institute and for-profit ventures to address health, hunger and climate change.

title: Swarming to San Francisco’s A.I. Boom: a New Crop of 20-Something CEOs
description: Some dropped out of M.I.T., Georgetown and Stanford. Others decided not to go to college. They all say they could not afford to wait to build their own artificial intelligence start-ups.

title: A.I. Has Ushered in Silicon Valley’s ‘Hard Tech’ Era
description: Goodbye to the age of consumer websites and mobile apps. Artificial intelligence has ushered in an era of what insiders in the nation’s innovation capital call “hard tech.”

title: Lina Khan: Democrats Can Learn from Zohran Mamdani
description: Democrats need to win back America’s small businesses.

title: Customers Griped About High Grocery Prices. The Grocer Agreed.
description: After hearing complaints about his prices, a store owner in Brooklyn has apologized, and begun the laborious task of lowering thousands of them.

title: Cognition AI Buys Windsurf as A.I. Frenzy Escalates
description: The deal follows Google’s $2.4 billion investment in Windsurf, an A.I. start-up, as companies race to gain technological talent and provide A.I. tools.

title: How Yemeni Cafes like Haraz Coffee House Are Building Momentum and Community
description: For cafes like Haraz Coffee House, riding a wave of interest nationwide in late-night, alcohol-free gathering spaces means embracing the franchise model.

title: The Coder ‘Village’ at the Heart of China’s A.I. Frenzy
description: As China vies with Silicon Valley for primacy, Hangzhou, home to DeepSeek and Alibaba, is where its aspiring tech titans mingle and share ideas.

title: The Perilous Business of Importing Indian Mangoes to the U.S.
description: For a few short months, dozens of part-time importers in New Jersey relentlessly compete to get the fruit into the hands of an eager diaspora.
